title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 January 2015 - XWiki
content:
<Bugendol1> has quit  
06:28 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
06:40 <Bugendolf> has quit  
06:41 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
07:12 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:20 <Chuguniy> has quit  
07:25 <RamonaConoro> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:57 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: Hi, there is some weird failure on commons, looks like the new rule directly or indirectly produce a NullPointerException  
10:28 <tmortagne> [ERROR] ComponentManager.java[0] (extension) TreeWalker: Got an exception - java.lang.NullPointerException  
10:29 <tmortagne> but no stack trace in the error, just the exception  
10:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok I'll check it out, it's probably due to my last commit yesterday night  
10:39 <lyes> has quit  
10:39 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <vmassol> should be ok now hopefully  
10:45 <vmassol> now you get real errors tmortagne http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-commons/140/console :)  
10:46 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes I saw them yesterday, I'm on it  
10:48 <vmassol> cool  
11:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: interesting read: http://www.infoq.com/articles/Java-Application-Hostile-to-JIT-Compilation  
11:08 <vmassol> (I didn't know about it)  
11:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: the title is at least :)  
11:09 <vmassol> :)  
11:18 <gsmeria> has quit  
11:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: this is indeed interesting, one more thing for me to check  
11:18 <vmassol> :)  
11:19 <vmassol> doesn't look that easy to do...  
11:20 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <tmortagne> vmassol: at least I will check method we call very often and see if they are inlinable  
11:23 <vmassol> yes  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> Hi  
11:33 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: are you able to backport XWIKI-11598 to stable-6.2.x?  
11:35 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: a simple cherry-pick should do it  
11:35 <tmortagne> actually 2 cherry-pick  
11:36 <tmortagne> better look at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11625 for the commits  
11:36 <tmortagne> do you want me to do it now ?  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: yes please  
11:47 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau, Denis: done  
11:50 <gdelhumeau> thx tmortagne  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: what do we do for XWIKI-11445?  
11:57 <gdelhumeau> seems fixed in 6.3  
11:57 <gdelhumeau> but for 6.2.5?  
11:57 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: no idea  
11:57 <gdelhumeau> oh, XWIKI-10776 is fixed in 6.2.3  
11:58 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: do we wait for the upgrade of xwiki.org to 6.4 to close it as "wont fix" or invalid?  
11:59 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you know better than me if there is lots of difference between 6.2.5 and 6.3 in this area :)  
11:59 <gdelhumeau> it seems the problem you had was because there were too few compilations alowed in the same time (not enough mutexes)  
12:00 <gdelhumeau> since 10776 changes that, it should be ok  
12:00 <tmortagne> hmm fixing a merge issue with my last cherry picj  
12:00 <tmortagne> pick  
12:00 <gdelhumeau> because myxwiki.org does not have the problem you said  
12:03 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I did not saw the issue in myxwiki.org as often as in xwiki.org yes so it's probably not too blocker for 6.2.5  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> not as often.  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> ?  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> it means you have it anyway sometimes?  
12:09 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it means nothing prevent having the same kind of issue but I did not saw it in myxwiki.org  
12:09 <tmortagne> in the same wiki with lots of incoming connection you can still have the same behavior in theory  
12:10 <tmortagne> but myxwiki.org is not that active even if there is tons on wikis on it  
12:10 <tmortagne> anyway as I said you should release 6.2.5 which is still way better than 6.2.4 that many people use in production  
12:33 <Enygma`> has quit  
12:35 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <Enygma`> tmortagne: have you seen http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/522/console ? Seems to be a NPE possible at DefaultCoreExtensionRepository.exists(DefaultCoreExtensionRepository.java:181)  
12:42 <vmassol> fixing commons quailty build  
12:43 <lucaa> has quit  
12:43 <vmassol> (http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-commons%20Quality%20Checks/139/console to be precise)  
12:43 <Enygma`> vmassol: what do you think about installing this https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Claim+plugin on our jenkins? :)  
12:44 <vmassol> reading  
12:45 <vmassol> I don't think we have communucation issues re fixing the build ATM  
12:45 <vmassol> I'm always wary of using jenkins plugins  
12:45 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:45 <vmassol> I've seen in the past that they can cause problems  
12:46 <vmassol> I think right now we have more the opposite problem :) ie to find people to fix the build in general  
12:46 <vmassol> what i'd like to fix really  
12:46 <vmassol> si to prevent having the RM the onus to get the func tests fixed  
12:46 <vmassol> \*is  
12:47 <vmassol> ie that somehow we're not allowed to leave func tests failling for more than 1-2 days  
12:47 <vmassol> haven't found the workflow that could work yet though...  
12:47 <Enygma`> well, a mail is already sent to the one responsible for breaking the build, AFAIK  
12:48 <vmassol> you're just proviing that it doesn't work :)  
12:48 <vmassol> and we know that  
12:48 <Enygma`> yes, because we`ve been getting too many of those  
12:48 <vmassol> that's why we need some different strategy  
12:48 <vmassol> I had one idea in the past: unreakable builds  
12:49 <vmassol> \*unbreakable  
12:49 <vmassol> I have another one but I'm not sure it'll work  
12:49 <vmassol> I need to think more about this but I'd like to do something in not too long  
12:50 <vmassol> brb  
12:57 <gsmeria> has quit  
12:58 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <lucaa> has quit  
13:22 <vmassol> fixing platform model  
13:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: unless you're on it  
13:22 <vmassol> btw would be nice if you guys could reply to my mail about the unstable annotation check  
13:22 <vmassol> I have refrained from fixing the code because I wanted to hear out from you first!  
13:23 <vmassol> (talking about the mail entitled "[Proposal] Automation Achievement Page on xwiki.org")  
13:23 <vmassol> err wrong mail  
13:24 <vmassol> (would also like a reply to this one ofc but it's less urgent...)  
13:27 <vmassol> hmm I wouldn't have merged XWIKI-11627 in 6.2.x  
13:28 <vmassol> not really a critical bug fix  
13:31 <gsmeria> has quit  
13:32 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <vmassol> so the mail I was referring to above is " [xwiki-devs] Removing @Unstable annotations"  
13:37 <vmassol> actually just realized I didn't ask for feedback since it was a rule already established :)  
13:37 <vmassol> so let's go ahead  
13:51 <msmeria> has quit  
13:52 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <vmassol> fixing bridge module  
14:05 <tmortagne> vmassol: XWIKI-11627 is not the goal, it's a dependency  
14:05 <vmassol> taking office importer now  
14:08 <vmassol> next is Localization, want to take it tmortagne?  
14:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: you can do it if you want, there is nothing special  
14:08 <vmassol> ok doing it  
14:09 <vmassol> it can be be interesting who devs who introduced the api to realize that they are now supposed to be stable  
14:09 <vmassol> s/who devs/for devs/  
14:10 <vmassol> for example I've just realized that my resources API are now supposed to be stable but I haven't progressed enough on them...  
14:11 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: taking wiki module now  
14:11 <vmassol> org.xwiki.wiki.descriptor.WikiDescriptor and org.xwiki.wiki.provisioning.WikiProvisioningJobRequest are now stable!  
14:11 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:12 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <vmassol> didn't remember we had a xwiki-platform-xar module  
14:15 <vmassol> not very nice coverage: <xwiki.jacoco.instructionRatio>0.0</xwiki.jacoco.instructionRatio>  
14:15 <vmassol> (for the xar module)  
14:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <vmassol> and almost all classes excluded fro checkstyle...  
14:18 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: same for org.xwiki.wiki.user.MemberCandidacy and org.xwiki.wiki.user.WikiUserConfiguration  
14:21 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you forgot to put a @since annotation on FSSkinReference.java  
14:36 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: putting 6.4M2...  
14:37 <vmassol> (assuming it was added by http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10708 )  
14:38 <cjd> has quit  
14:42 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <lucaa> has quit  
14:55 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: and org.xwiki.wiki.template.WikiTemplatePropertyGroup  
14:56 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <vmassol> glad this one is internal because I don't like the name at all: org.xwiki.wiki.user.internal.WikiUserConfigurationHelper :)  
14:57 <vmassol> smells bad design  
15:01 <vmassol> ok removed all @unstable anno on platform  
15:01 <vmassol> (the ones that needed to be removed ;))  
15:08 <msmeria> has quit  
15:11 <tmortagne> ClemensR: just to be sure, there is no support of repetition in mocca calendar or I'm just blind ?  
15:11 <ClemensR> tmortagne:  no there is not yet  
15:12 <tmortagne> any jira issue I can follow or should I create one ?  
15:12 <tmortagne> (I could not find one)  
15:12 <ClemensR> I thought there is one ... one moment  
15:13 <tmortagne> if there is one it should probably be a dependency of MOCCACAL-38  
15:14 <ClemensR> strange, there really is no issue for recurring events - I was sure it is there because I know it is a much wanted feature  
15:14 <tmortagne> sounds like something that could be a much wanted feature yes :)  
15:15 <ClemensR> no issue found, feel free to create one  
15:15 <tmortagne> ok, doing it  
15:17 <tmortagne> MOCCACAL-67  
15:18 <ClemensR> Thanks!  I am not sure if and when someone is going to implement it. Currently the project is a bit in a not so good state, as some work is lingering on a feature branch waiting for the next FullCallendar Macro release ...  
15:19 <tmortagne> ClemensR: ok, it's not a critical need on my side, was just wondering  
15:23 <lucaa> has quit  
15:23 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <vmassol> there are 12 failing tests in platform  
15:33 <vmassol> related to Macro tests  
15:33 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/763/#showFailuresLink  
15:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: any idea?  
15:33 <vmassol> all caused by some component failing to be found  
15:33 <vmassol> Caused by: org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.configuration.ConfigurationSource] hint = [xwikicfg]]  
15:33 <tmortagne> not so much related to macro test, see my last commit  
15:34 <vmassol> you refactored someting?  
15:34 <tmortagne> that's because the displayer now use the xwiki.cfg configuration source  
15:34 <vmassol> ok  
15:34 <tmortagne> not really  
15:34 <tmortagne> just added some if on an option  
15:37 <vrachieru> has quit  
15:38 <sburjan> has quit  
15:51 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki

16:21 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: mflorea: there is faling test on the 6.2.x branch: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-6.2.x/259/testReport/  
16:23 <gdelhumeau> I would like to release 6.2.5 today, is there anything you want to add on it? tmortagne, vmassol, Enygma`, evalica, ClemensR, mflorea, Denis?  
16:24 <ClemensR> nothing urgent to add from me  
16:24 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: no, fine on my side  
16:25 <Denis> gdelhumeau: fine for me as well  
16:26 <evalica> gdelhumeau: nothing on my side  
16:33 <gsmeria> has quit  
16:36 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.xpn.xwiki.XWiki.getPlainUserName(Lorg/xwiki/model/reference/DocumentReference;Lcom/xpn/xwiki/XWikiContext;)  
16:36 <Bugen\_do> has joined #xwiki  
16:36 <tmortagne> sounds like a test run on a half built platform

16:59 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: nothing on my side either
